page.title: 17Education in Fremington .
page.content: Our school was built in 1957, but it has had some mobile classrooms added. There are 5 junior classes, 3 infant classes and a nursery unit. There are about 220 children. We have a big hall, a swimming pool which is 12 meters long, a play ground with pitches and games on it, a football pitch and a big field to play on. WE are starting a wild area where the grass and the weeds are not cut. There are going to be 2 ponds and there are lots of frogs. The nearest primary schools are Instow and Sticklepath The nearest comprehensive schools are at Barnstaple. Children who go there have to leave early to catch the bus. There are some private schools in the area as well.
